formattedAddress: 9 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 9 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA

editorialSummary.text: Fast-food chain offering Mexican fare, including design-your-own burritos, tacos & bowls.

originalText.text:
1. Racial discrimination, employees are careless and have bad attitudes, and the manager doesn’t care how to solve the problem.
2. The ordering was confusing. I said I wanted to take it away, but the employee ignored it.
3. When paying, you didn’t ask me which one I ordered. In fact, I ordered the barbacoa bowl and was charged the price of the chicken bowl.
2. I didn’t order extra lettuce, but I was charged $1.70 for sides.
3. Actually you are charging my friend for lettuce
4. When my friend ordered, she didn't get the normal portion of lettuce, it was much less than mine. So she asked for more lettuce. The server said extra lettuce would cost more and she refused. She repeated just more vegetable many times. Then the waiter agreed. But in the end you took our money again.
5. I have recorded a video of ordering (recording my life).
6. We requested a refund for the $1.7 sides and received an apology.
So this is Chipotle’s service attitude? No one answered me! If there is no response, I will upload the video to the social media platform, you will lose not only us two customers, but thousands of people.

originalText.text: So I have been here multiple times and have always had a pleasant experience. It's always clean and food has been great. However I have only been here on weekends for lunch, so I can't comment on how it is during the work week.

text.text: So I have been here multiple times and have always had a pleasant experience. It's always clean and food has been great. However I have only been here on weekends for lunch, so I can't comment on how it is during the work week.

originalText.text:
One of the worst customer service I’ve ever seen. This was my first time trying and will be my last. Although the food was great, I do not think it’s worth the risk of getting yelled while having to spend money.

Being a first customer, I just politely asking her 1-2 questions on what the sauces were and what meat it was, then she ended up throwing the serving spoon and told another staff to take over. Over 2 questions… The cashier was the nicest overall.

Honestly, I don’t know why someone like her is still working there. After just looking at the review seems like I’m not the only one who experienced this. Chipotle should take action on this.

originalText.text: It was really good. However the less spicy option was still quite spicy for me. But other than that you have a good choice of fillings.

text.text: It was really good. However the less spicy option was still quite spicy for me. But other than that you have a good choice of fillings.

originalText.text:
I’m writing this review to highlight my disappointing experience with the customer service at this location. Upon arrival, the employee at the counter seemed uninviting, which gave me an initial sense of the service to expect. Despite my reservations, I proceeded to order a rice bowl with chicken, specifically asking for extra chicken and extra side of corn, acknowledging the additional cost.

However, the preparer emphasized the extra cost, even after I confirmed my willingness to pay. My bill reflected the extra charge, but the portion of chicken was hardly more than standard. When I questioned this discrepancy, I was informed about their “one scoop” rule, even though my serving didn’t seem to match the extra I paid for or the standard portion.

It’s disheartening to see such service quality in NYC, especially when there’s a push to revive the service economy post-pandemic. I tried to support this location twice within a week, but the encounters on both Tuesday and Wednesday were far from satisfactory. While I’m all for supporting local businesses, I cannot recommend this establishment. There are numerous alternatives, and with the poor service and questionable portioning tools (a flat spoon hardly serves its purpose), I’d rather opt for more reliable options like Whole Foods. Choose wisely for the sake of your experience and the community.
